revision.comment: /* top */clean up, replaced: hynix → SK hynix, SK SK hynix → SK hynix

|cpu1_cores = 1 |cpu1_type = MIPS 24Kc |cpu1_type_rev = |cpu1spd = 400 |is_doc = |bus = 32-bit |flash1type = |fla1_num = 2 |fla1chip = Winbond;25Q128BVFG; |flash1size = 32 |flash1maxsize = |ram1type = DDR2 |ram1type1 = |ram1spd = |ram1size = 64 |ram1chip = SK hynix;H5PS516GFA; |ram1_num = |nvramsize = |eth_cpu = true |sw1chip = Atheros;AR8316;AR8316-AK1E; |wan_ports = 1 |wan_speed = 1GbE |lan_ports = 4 |lan_speed = 1GbE |ethstandard = IEEE 802.3, 802.3u, 802.3ab |portbasedvlan = |802.1qvlan = |auto_mdix = |sup_jumbo = |ethoui = |oui = |bootwait = |stockbootloader = |stockos = |exp_if_types = USB 2.0 |exp_usb_num = 1 |usb_hub = |pwr_volt_type = VDC |pwr_vdc = 12 |pwr_amp_dc = 1.5 |pwr_conn = barrel |pwr_barrel_outer = |pwr_barrel_inner = |pwr_barrel_len = |pwr_pol = |serial = |jtag = |specialfeat = |flags = |addchip = |802dot11_protocols = bgn |defaulip = |defaultlogin = |defaultpass = |defaultssid = |defaultssid_regex = |default_ch = |manuf = Delta Networks |manuf_model = |manuf_rev = |is_manuf = No |tpfirmware = DD-WRT |availability = |eoldate = |fccapprovdate = 05/27/2011 |estreldate = 07/15/2011 |reldate = |estprice = |upc = 747464123073 |ean = |dx_sku = |newegg = N82E16833162048 |asin = B005CSOE1G |asin_country = |asin2 = |asin_country2 = |countrymanuf = China |buttons = |led = |dimensions = 6.5 x 6.2 x 2.2 in. |weight = |wi1_if_name = |rad1chip1 = Atheros;AR9381; |rad1oui = |rad1_ant_conn = RP-SMA |rad1txchains = 3 |rad1rxchains = 3 |rad1sstreams = 3 |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11b/g/n |rad1n = 450 |rad1g = 54 |rad1b = 11 |rad1freq = 2.4 }}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== Per [http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?t=140474 this] DD-WRT forums post, the shields are soldered on preventing removal for chip identification. The wireless chip appears to be an AR9381 or AR9384.. as the AR9384 does not seem to exist, it can be assumed the device uses AR9381. [http://www.wifi.com.cn/forum/viewthread.php?action=printable&tid=52412 This post on wifi.com.cn] says the device uses AR7242, AR8316, AR9381, and has 32MB + 64MB of Flash and RAM.. respectively. The AR8316 is visible in the FCC photos. [http://tpholic.com/xe/7998173 DD-WRT router info screenshot] confirming AR7242, the default FW is DD-WRT The FCC photos show the device with an MAC sticker with an OUI of 4C:E6:76. "2976374002" is silkscreened on the board in the FCC photos. Outside the USA the propietary Buffalo firmware is available, starting at the initial 1.75 followed by 1.76 and as begin 2012 the 1.85 version. But outside the USA it ships with a "professional firmware" installed and this is a DD-WRT firmware with Buffalo Logo. Both flavors can be obtained from http://www.buffalo-technology.com, the European Buffalo site. ==Links of Interest== [http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16833162048 On Newegg] (reviews) ==Flashing== {{Flashnotice}} ===Flashing dd-wrt=== Supported by dd-wrt as of = wzr_hp_g450h build 22118 20130724 Please insert instructions here ==JTAG-Serial Info== ===Serial=== ====Serial Pinouts==== Top Row: gnd, rx, tx, vcc
Bottom Row: rx, tx, gnd, vcc ==Pictures==
